intro: Galarhoeus lathyris, commonly known as the lesser lathyris, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Galarhoeus lathyris is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
